page.title: 16THE HANSEATIC BOD,SYMBISTER
page.content: Between the 13th & 17th centuries merchants from the Hanseatic ports of Europe traded with Shetland. They sailed here in spring with fishing gear,food,drink and household goods which they traded for fish and other produce. They arrived in late spring and stayed until late summer. The Bod or "booth" was a trading warehouse belonging to merchants from Bremen.It was built sometime in the 16th century at the same time as the old harbour.The trade declined and ended when the Scottish parliament intervened to stop it in the late 17th century. Recently the booth has been used as a store but by the 1970's it was in disrepair.It has now been restored by a trust who plan to have it open this year(1985) as an exhibition and visitors centre.
